content:
The provided code chunk is part of a function responsible for transforming specific LaTeX-like commands (`@verbatim`/`@endcode` and `@f[`/`@f]`) into equivalent Sphinx directives (`.. code-block:: guess` and `.. math::`) respectively. This facilitates proper formatting of code blocks and mathematical expressions in the generated documentation.

The context is that this code is used to enhance the autodocumentation process, ensuring that certain LaTeX-style commands are correctly interpreted and converted into appropriate reStructuredText directives for better rendering in Sphinx-generated documentation.

newlines.append('.. code-block:: guess')
                newlines.append('')
                offset = line.index('@' + special)
                while lines:
                    line = lines.pop(0)
                    if '@endverbatim' in line or '@endcode' in line:
                        break
                    newlines.append('   ' + line[offset:])

                newlines.append('')
                continue
            elif special == "f[":
                if newlines and newlines[-1]:
                    newlines.append('')

                newlines.append('.. math::')
                newlines.append('')
                offset = line.index('@' + special)
                while lines:
                    line = lines.pop(0)
                    if '@f]' in line:
                        break
                    newlines.append('   ' + line[offset:])
